title: Spicy chicken nasi goreng
description: Chicken nasi goreng is a real treat! Try something different with this quick, spicy Indonesian dish.
ingredients: 2 skinless chicken breasts, sliced into strips
Handful of fresh coriander, roughly chopped
Kecap manis (a thick sweet Indonesian soy sauce), to serve

method.Step 1: Beat the eggs together in a large bowl and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat 1 teaspoon of the oil in a deep,wide,non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Add half the eggs in a thin layer and cook for a few minutes, until set and golden underneath. Tip out, roll up, allow to cool, then finely slice. Add another teaspoon of the oil to the frying pan and cook the remaining eggs as before.

method.Step 2: Heat the remaining oil in the pan and fry the shallots for 5 minutes, until crisp and golden. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. Discard the oil and wipe the pan clean.

method.Step 3: Heat the curry paste in the pan, add the chicken and stir-fry for 3â€“4 minutes, until the chicken is nearly cooked through. Add the rice and prawns and stir-fry for 1 minute, tossing well in the curry paste. Remove from the heat and stir in the sliced egg, crispy shallots, cucumber and the coriander, tossing well together.

method.Step 4: Divide the nasi goreng between wide bowls and serve with prawn crackers and kecap manis.
